name: sfchronicle
text:
The pharmaceutical company that makes the antiviral drug remdesivir — which has shown promise as a treatment for COVID-19 — will begin trials for an inhalable version of the medication this summer.

https://t.co/ytHPSqhEv6

name: sfchronicle
text: California has unveiled a new watch-list program meant to monitor county-level coronavirus indicators as the state reopens. https://t.co/p3Dl0sQQ21

name: sfchronicle
text:
A federal judge wiped away tears as he discussed the increasingly disastrous coronavirus outbreak at San Quentin.

"We know what's going to happen," he said. "We know." 

https://t.co/7Nv6zBK0qk

name: sfchronicle
text: Jaylin Davis (@Jay_Dave23) is the only African American on the S.F. Giants’ 40-man roster. In a recent blog post, Davis expressed his support for the Black Lives Matter movement and the racism he's experienced in baseball — and what needs to change. https://t.co/BHqpKQfwxs

name: sfchronicle
text:
Here’s a look at what virtual events are lined up for San Francisco Pride’s 50th anniversary:

https://t.co/TKx2HznwCI

name: sfchronicle
text:
Federal judge rules California cannot require a cancer warning label on Monsanto’s Roundup herbicide, despite three jury verdicts awarding nearly $200 million to cancer victims.
https://t.co/ZnzEWZrFOt

name: sfchronicle
text:
Bay Area surpasses 20,000 coronavirus cases on Monday, marking the day with the highest number of new cases, according to data collected from California counties by The Chronicle.
https://t.co/xe3P4HvmlT
